verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime:
verses.web: LORD says: “For three transgressions of Moab, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime;
verses.ct: The LORD says: "Moab has sinned again and again, and I will not hold back their punishment — because they burned the bones of the king of Edom until they turned to powder.

verses.kjv: But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces of Kirioth: and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet:
verses.web: but I will send a fire on Moab, and it will devour the palaces of Kerioth; and Moab will die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet;
verses.ct: So I will send fire on Moab, and it will consume the fortresses of Kerioth. Moab will collapse in chaos — in the roar of battle cries and the blast of war trumpets.

verses.kjv: And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will slay all the princes thereof with him, saith the LORD.
verses.web: and I will cut off the judge from among them, and will kill all its princes with him,” says LORD.
verses.ct: I will wipe out their ruler and execute every one of their leaders along with him," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the LORD, and have not kept his commandments, and their lies caused them to err, after the which their fathers have walked:
verses.web: LORD says: “For three transgressions of Judah, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because they have rejected LORD’s law, and have not kept his statutes, and their lies have led them astray, after which their fathers walked;
verses.ct: The LORD says: "Judah has sinned again and again, and I will not hold back their punishment — because they rejected the law of the LORD and refused to obey his commands. The same false gods that led their ancestors astray have led them astray too.

verses.kjv: But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.
verses.web: but I will send a fire on Judah, and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”
verses.ct: So I will send fire on Judah, and it will consume the fortresses of Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away the punishment thereof; because they sold the righteous for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes;
verses.web: LORD says: “For three transgressions of Israel, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because they have sold the righteous for silver, and the needy for a pair of sandals;
verses.ct: The LORD says: "Israel has sinned again and again, and I will not hold back their punishment — because they sell honest people for silver and the poor for a pair of sandals.

verses.kjv: That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in unto the same maid, to profane my holy name:
verses.web: They trample on the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and deny justice to the oppressed; and a man and his father use the same maiden, to profane my holy name;
verses.ct: They grind the faces of the helpless into the dirt and shove the oppressed out of the way. A father and his son sleep with the same young woman, dragging my holy name through the mud.

verses.kjv: And they lay themselves down upon clothes laid to pledge by every altar, and they drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.
verses.web: and they lay themselves down beside every altar on clothes taken in pledge; and in the house of their God they drink the wine of those who have been fined.
verses.ct: They stretch out beside every altar on garments taken as collateral from the poor, and in the house of their God they drink wine bought with money squeezed from those they've fined.

verses.kjv: Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.
verses.web: Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.
verses.ct: "Yet I'm the one who destroyed the Amorites to make room for them — a people as tall as cedar trees and as strong as oaks. I destroyed them completely, from their branches above to their roots below.

verses.kjv: Also I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and led you forty years through the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.
verses.web: Also I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and led you forty years in the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorite.
verses.ct: I'm the one who brought you out of Egypt and guided you through the wilderness for 40 years so you could take over the land of the Amorites.

verses.kjv: And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith the LORD.
verses.web: I raised up some of your sons for prophets, and some of your young men for Nazirites. Isn’t this true, you children of Israel?” says LORD.
verses.ct: I chose some of your sons to be prophets and some of your young men to be Nazirites. Isn't this true, people of Israel?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: But ye gave the Nazarites wine to drink; and commanded the prophets, saying, Prophesy not.
verses.web: “But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, and commanded the prophets, saying, ‘Don’t prophesy!’
verses.ct: "But you pressured the Nazirites to drink wine, and you ordered the prophets, 'Don't prophesy!'

verses.kjv: Behold, I am pressed under you, as a cart is pressed that is full of sheaves.
verses.web: Behold, I will crush you in your place, as a cart crushes that is full of grain.
verses.ct: Now watch — I will crush you where you stand, the way a cart loaded with grain crushes everything beneath it.

verses.kjv: Therefore the flight shall perish from the swift, and the strong shall not strengthen his force, neither shall the mighty deliver himself:
verses.web: Flight will perish from the swift; and the strong won’t strengthen his force; neither shall the mighty deliver himself;
verses.ct: The fastest runners won't be able to escape. The strongest warriors will lose their strength. Even the mightiest soldiers won't be able to save themselves.

verses.kjv: Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he that is swift of foot shall not deliver himself: neither shall he that rideth the horse deliver himself.
verses.web: neither shall he stand who handles the bow; and he who is swift of foot won’t escape; neither shall he who rides the horse deliver himself;
verses.ct: Archers won't hold their ground. The quickest on their feet won't outrun it. Even those on horseback won't get away.

verses.kjv: And he that is courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day, saith the LORD.
verses.web: and he who is courageous among the mighty will flee away naked on that day,” says LORD.
verses.ct: On that day, even the bravest warriors will throw down their armor and run for their lives," says the LORD.
